heroIntro: Welcome to your ideal family home in Dolores, Costa Blanca. This exceptional 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers the perfect blend of modern comfort and practical family living. With 90m² of thoughtfully designed living space set on a 155m² plot, your family will enjoy room to grow and outdoor space for weekend gatherings. At €420,000, this property represents outstanding value—40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets—making premium Costa Blanca living accessible to families seeking both quality and affordability. Dolores has become increasingly popular with British and international families who appreciate the safe, welcoming community atmosphere combined with excellent schools, healthcare facilities, and proximity to some of Spain's finest beaches. Whether you're looking for a primary residence or a sound investment property that generates strong rental returns, this villa in the heart of Dolores delivers exceptional value and lifestyle potential. The region has seen consistent 8% year-on-year growth, making this an astute purchase for families building their Spanish future.
areaSection: Dolores is a charming white village nestled in the heart of the Alicante interior, traditionally known for its agricultural heritage and authentic Spanish character. Located just 30 minutes from the Mediterranean coast and within easy reach of multiple Blue Flag beaches, the town offers the perfect balance between peaceful village living and coastal accessibility. The climate is typically Mediterranean—warm, sunny days year-round with mild winters—ideal for outdoor family activities. Dolores has undergone careful modernization while maintaining its traditional Spanish village atmosphere, with tree-lined streets, local plazas for community gatherings, and a strong sense of neighborhood pride. The surrounding countryside features olive groves, almond orchards, and rolling hills that provide stunning natural backdrops and outdoor exploration opportunities for active families.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Dolores centers around family values, community connection, and easy access to both relaxation and adventure. The established international community means English is widely spoken, making integration smooth for British and foreign families. Your morning coffee at a local café, afternoon siesta tradition, and evening paseos through the village square create a slower pace that many families find rejuvenating. Shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets, plus authentic weekly markets offering fresh local produce. Healthcare is excellent, with private clinics offering English-speaking doctors and a regional hospital within 30 minutes. Weekend plans might include trips to nearby Blue Flag beaches for swimming and water sports, golfing at championship courses, or exploring the charming coastal towns of the Costa Blanca. The family-friendly atmosphere means children thrive in local schools with international curriculum options, and extracurricular activities abound. Evening meals out at family-friendly restaurants feature both Spanish cuisine and international options catering to diverse palates.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment opportunity in one of Costa Blanca's most stable property markets. Priced at €4,667/m², it sits significantly above the Dolores average of €2,200/m² due to its premium new-build specification and quality finishes—yet remains 40% less expensive than comparable properties in Mallorca or Ibiza. The region has demonstrated consistent growth at 8% year-on-year, outperforming many European property markets. With typical weekly rental rates of €800 for family-oriented properties in the area, owners can expect attractive returns during peak seasons (June-September and Easter). Many investors successfully combine personal use with rental income, enjoying the property during winter months while generating revenue in summer. The established expat community means consistent rental demand from international buyers seeking authentic Costa Blanca experiences. Properties in Dolores have shown strong appreciation, with family-oriented 3-bedroom villas particularly popular among UK buyers seeking Mediterranean homes.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom villa in Dolores represents far more than a property purchase—it's an investment in your family's Mediterranean future. At €420,000, you're acquiring not just a home, but access to excellent schools, welcoming international community, outstanding healthcare, beautiful beaches, and a lifestyle significantly more affordable than UK living. The consistent market growth and strong rental potential provide financial security while you and your family build lasting Spanish memories. The safe, family-focused atmosphere of Dolores combined with convenient access to modern amenities makes everyday living enjoyable and stress-free. Whether you're seeking a primary residence, holiday retreat, or investment property, this villa delivers exceptional value and potential. Contact us today via WhatsApp to arrange a viewing and discover why so many families have chosen Dolores as their Costa Blanca home. Your family's Spanish adventure awaits.

Dental care is also excellent and significantly more affordable than UK alternatives, making this an additional financial advantage for families planning long-term residency.

faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €420,000. This 3-bedroom villa offers premium new-build specifications at a price significantly below comparable properties in Mallorca or Ibiza. The price includes the 155m² plot and represents outstanding value for families seeking Costa Blanca living. Payment plans and mortgage options are available for qualifying buyers.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca has demonstrated consistent 8% year-on-year growth, established international communities, excellent healthcare and education, and strong rental potential. The region suits families, retirees, and investors seeking reliable property markets with Mediterranean lifestyle benefits and affordable living costs compared to UK alternatives.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes. UK citizens and other foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without residency requirements. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which your lawyer obtains as part of the purchase process. Spanish property law is clear and well-established for international buyers, with English-speaking legal professionals available throughout Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property purchase price, expect transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), legal and notary fees (€1,000-€2,000), and agency fees (typically 5%). For a €420,000 property, total additional costs approximate €38,000-€50,000. Ongoing costs include annual property tax (0.4-1.1%), community fees if applicable (€50-150/month), and utilities. These remain significantly lower than UK equivalents.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to UK citizens and other foreigners. Most require 30% down payment and proof of income. Interest rates are competitive, typically 2-4% fixed. Mortgage terms extend to 25-30 years. British mortgage brokers specializing in Spanish properties can streamline the process and secure optimal terms.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers significantly lower living costs than the UK. Grocery shopping costs approximately 20-30% less; restaurant meals are 40% cheaper; utility bills run 30% lower; and property costs are substantially reduced. A family of four typically budgets €1,500-€2,000 monthly for comfortable living including rent/mortgage, utilities, food, and entertainment—considerably less than UK equivalents.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca bra för pensionärer?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts retirees due to year-round sunshine, affordable living, excellent healthcare with English-speaking doctors, established communities of retired expats, active social programs, and vibrant entertainment options. The region offers both peaceful village living and coastal activities, suiting diverse retirement preferences. Healthcare costs are minimal compared to UK care.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 2.5 hours flying time from UK airports. Direct flights operate regularly to London, Manchester, and other UK cities. Many residents make frequent trips home, and budget airlines keep fares competitive. This proximity makes it ideal for families maintaining UK connections while enjoying Mediterranean living.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ sunny days annually. Summers (June-August) reach 28-32°C with low rainfall; winters are mild at 10-15°C requiring only light clothing. Spring and autumn are perfect for outdoor activities. This climate enables year-round outdoor family activities—beaches, golf, cycling, and gardens thrive in natural conditions.

faqs.question: Is Dolores suitable for families with young children?
faqs.answer: Yes. Dolores is exceptionally family-friendly with a safe, established community, excellent schools including international options, parks and outdoor spaces, and proximity to beaches. The village pace provides a relaxed environment for children's development, while nearby amenities ensure parents don't sacrifice convenience. Many British families with young children choose Dolores specifically for these qualities.
